He also competed in CDE's as a Junior and went to state with the Ag Mech team at Sam Houston. He competed in Ag Mechanics shows since the 7th grade all the way through high school and never placed below 5th. His Sophomore year, he won his class in the Gooseneck Trailer division at the San Antonio Stock Show and Rodeo placing first in class and ultimately receiving Reserve Champion of the Gooseneck Trailer Division at the Houston Stock Show and Rodeo. Baker will graduate with 3 college hours and plans on attending Texas Tech University and majoring in Mechanical Engineering in pursuit of a job in the oil or agriculture mechanical field.

post_text: Glen Rose High School students took first, second, and fourth place at the 2020 UIL District 7-4A CX Debate meet! During the district meet, GRHS teams had 9 wins and only 1 loss. The team of Ayari Araujo Beltran and Paloma Gonzalez went undefeated as did the team of John Hague and Jody Keahey. By making it to the final round, both of these teams qualified for the State Meet on March 19-21 in Austin. The two teams decided not to debate against each other and to let a coin flip determine their district finish. Beltran/Gonzalez won the toss and will represent District 7-4A in Austin as the first seed while Hague/Keahey will go as the second district seed. The team of Charles Simons and Jacob Merrill finished fourth place with a 3 and 1 record. All three teams upheld the reputation of strong debate teams from Glen Rose High School. The man behind much of the success is the outstanding debate coach, Mr. Bryan Sowell. Mr. Sowell has now coached 47 state academic UIL qualifiers from Glen Rose High School.

Glen Rose ISD Theatre Department
January 24 at 4:27 PM ·

It's 2nd Grade Art Festival Day at Glen Rose Elementary!!!! Theatre III students get this annual opportunity to teach the students about the masters of old by portraying different characters such as Frida Kahlo, the wife of Claude Monet, Sofonisba Anguissola and her sister Lucia, Andy Warhol, Georgia O'Keeffe and many more. These students have been working hard since December to prepare for this day, and it is such a joy to watch them bring history to life!
